name: src/Button.js
Button
description: Button encapsulates a button element with a custom onClick event fn

unknown.tagValue: {string} label - the button label
{string} value - the button value to be passed up to Main.getSource
{string} unit -
{boolean} selected -
{function} onEvent - handleFieldChange from Main
{function} highlight -

name: onEvent
description: onClick, this fn

name: src/ButtonBox.js
src/CloseButton.js
CloseButton
description:
CloseButton displays a commly used 'close' icon.
onClick, this button executes a function passed to it.

unknown.tagValue:
{function} handleCloseButton - a function appropriate
for a close button. Function will likely be from the parent so actions
occur in the correct scope.

name: src/CycleButtonBox.js
CycleButtonBox
description: ButtonBox for Cycles

unknown.tagValue: {Button[]} cycles - an array of Button components
{string} classname - the className for this button box
{function} onEvent - function, handleCycleChange from Main

name: src/DataCanvas.js
DataCanvas
description: DataCanvas renders the image product plain and simple.

unknown.tagValue: {HTML Element} img - an img element we want to see

name: src/DataCanvasContainer.js
DataCanvasContainer
description:
DataCanvasContainer handles preloading of images and sending the
image element that corresponds to the selected image product
 to the DataCanvas component.

unknown.tagValue: {function} getSource - getSource from Main, returns the src for an img
{function} handleUnitChange - from Main, update the selected unit on Main state
{Object} units - the units object, tells us start, by, and the header
{string} unitType - the unitType for the selected product
{string} unitThreshold - the max unit value for this cycle (from the Cycle object)
{string} product - the selected product
{string} cycle - the selected cycle
{string} date - the selected date
{string} domainImg - an image element when Domain of the Day is on, null if not

name: componentDidUpdate
description:
Only preload again if there is a change in:
 product - that is a whole new file name,
 cycle - that represents a new directory,
  or
 date - that also represents a new directory

unknown.tagValue: {Object} prevProps - to be compared to current props
{Object} prevState - default param for this React lifecycle method. unused here.

name: getUnitData
description: Modularize getting the value out of the units object given a key.

params.name: property
params.description: a key in the units object

return.description: the value of the property key in the units object

name: getValues
description:
Every given unit type increases by a set amount, stored in the
units object on props. Every given unit also has a max. With this
getValues determines how many unit buttons need to be rendered
and what those units should be. These values correspond to the units
on the file names for the image products.

return.description: values - an array of the strings that will be unit button labels

name: preload
description:
Get the array of values for the units, map to Promises that fullfill
 Image elements on load with urls based on the unit values.
 Set values, array of images and the promises to state.

name: change
description: Update the index so the correct img element passes to DataCanvas

name: render
description: renders UnitButtonBox and DataCanvas

name: src/DateMenu.js
DateMenu
description:
DateMenu is a Menu that can be "open" or not.
When closed it appears to be a button. When open, it
utilizes a portal to display a div beside it with
clickable date-labeled buttons.

unknown.tagValue: {string[]} dates - a list of date strings that will become buttons in the open div
{function} handleMenuToggle - from MenuBox (parent), handles the style logic
{function} handleChange - from Main, handleDateChange
{boolean} open - the source of style logic
{string} title - the label for the closed menu

name: componentDidMount
description: dates must be sorted, bounding rectangle for portal established

name: getStyle
description:
Set the rectangle object to state. The open menu div
has to be positioned relative to this rectangle.

name: parseDates
description: dates are parsed as datefns objects and sorted latest first

name: render
description:
When closed, renders a button displaying props.title
 Style determined with props.open, deconstructed and
 controlling the "open" className via cx.
When open, renders the button displaying props.title
 and a Popup > div > PopupContent.
 PopupContent children include CloseButton, MonthHeader,
  and TrowFragment

return.description: button, Popup > div > PopupContent

name: src/DirectoryMenu.js
DirectoryMenu
description:
DirectoryMenu is a Menu that can be "open" or not.
When open, it utilizes a portal to display a div
beside it with clickable date-labeled buttons.
This component is good for the clones where directories are not
necessarily dates. This will just contain a dump of directory names.

unknown.tagValue: {string[]} dirs - a list of date strings that will become buttons in the open div
{function} handleMenuToggle - from MenuBox (parent), handles the style logic
{function} handleChange - from Main, handleDirChange
{boolean} open - the source of style logic
{string} title - the label for the closed menu

name: componentDidMount
description: bounding rectangle for portal must be established

name: getStyle
description:
Set the rectangle object to state. The open menu div
has to be positioned relative to this rectangle.

name: render
description:
When closed, renders a button displaying props.title
 Style determined with props.open, deconstructed and
 controlling the "open" className via cx.
When open, renders the button displaying props.title
 and a Popup > div > PopupContent.
 PopupContent chilren include CloseButton, and TrowFragment

name: src/DomainButton.js
DomainButton
description:
This button signals to Main that the Domain of the Day
 img should be displayed or taken down.

 DomainButton is a button with state storing a boolean, clicked.
 Clicked status is passed up to parent component(s).

unknown.tagValue: {function} onClick - a function that takes a boolean argument

name: onClick
description: Flip clicked on state, pass clicked to parent

name: render
description: Renders a button styled logically with clicked deconstructed from state

name: src/FieldMenu.js
FieldMenu
description:
FieldMenu is a Menu that can be "open" or not.
When closed it appears to be a button. When open, it
utilizes a portal to display a div beside it with
clickable field-labeled buttons in a style similar to a table.

unknown.tagValue: {string} title - the label for the button

{Object} menuData - an object with menu categories, subcategories,
                                  names of products and file names

{function} handleMenuToggle - takes a string (props.title)
                                             tells parent the menu was clicked
{boolean} open - controls the style of the open and closed state

{function} handleCloseButton - from parent container. ensures
                                             close button closes the menu
{function} handleFieldChange - from Main, update the product selection

name: state
description: stores the rectangle for coordinates

name: handleMenuToggle
description: Tell parent component that this FieldMenu was toggled.

name: componentDidMount
description: bounding rectangle for portal established

name: getStyle
description:
Set the rectangle object to state. The open menu div
has to be positioned relative to this rectangle.

name: render
description:
When closed, renders a button displaying props.title
 Style determined with props.open, deconstructed and
 controlling the "open" className via cx.
When open, renders the button displaying props.title
 and a Popup > div > PopupContent.
 PopupContent children is an array of buttons.
Rendered components not yet listed are CloseButton and FaQuestionCircle.

return.description: button, div > Popup > div > PopupContent

name: src/HoverButton.js
HoverButton
description: A button that is active on mouse over, not click.

unknown.tagValue: {string} label - the label for the button
{string} value - the value to pass up to parent on mouseover
{string} unitType - the unit type to pass up to parent on mouseover
{function} onEvent - function vehicle for button action
{fucntion} highlight - optional. function that controls the style
{boolean} selected - controls conditional style

name: onEvent
description:
Pass value and unit type up to parents.
  If this button has a highlight prop, highlight.

name: render
description: Renders

return.description: a button styled conditionally on props.selected.

name: src/Main.js
Main
description: Main stores the processed app state. Renders two MenuBox and a DataCanvasContainer

name: getSource
description: Get the source string for the selected image.

return.description: path to the image product that has been selected

name: handleDomainOftheDay
description:
do a quick swap of the domainImg if true
when the bool is false, put the former product back

params.name: bool
params.description:
weather or not the Domain of the Day button
has been selected

name: handleDateChange
description:
update the state and the query string in the url without refreshing the app
the domainImg is set to null so the DataCanvasContainer will know to prefer the images preloaded there

name: handleCycleChange
description:
update the state and the query string in the url without refreshing the app
the domainImg is set to null so the DataCanvasContainer will know to prefer the images preloaded there

name: handleFieldChange
description:
update the state and the query string in the url without refreshing the app
the domainImg is set to null so the DataCanvasContainer will know to prefer the images preloaded there

params.name: unit
params.description: the unit type for this field

name: handleUnitChange
description:
the unit is the f number following the field/product name
update the state and the query string in the url without refreshing the app
the domainImg is set to null so the DataCanvasContainer will know to prefer the images preloaded there

name: src/MainContainer.js
MainContainer
description:
MainContainer is the container for the raw app state,
 where data is fetched for the menus and processed, where the
 query strings are processed and changed, and all data is passed
 down to the app.

name: componentWillMount
description:
Retrieve dates and data -- all essential for the
app to render

name: getDates
description:
Fetches the list of directories named with date strings
At present no part of this app is smart. Date log is the
product of a manual listing process.

return.description: text - an Array of strings that are processed for DateMenu

name: getData
description: Fetches json to populate the menus and provide unit rules and limits on cycles

return.description: json - the app data

name: getInitialState
description: Processes query strings, if any, and sets initial state object for Main

types: { selectedDate: string, selectedCycle: string, selectedField: string, selectedUnit: string,     selectedFieldUnitType: string }

name: getProductUnitLookup
description: Loop through the given object to find and map values to their unit type

return.description: an object where values are mapped to unit type

name: getUrlParameter
description:
Manually grab the query string for the arg we ask for.
Borrowed from https://davidwalsh.name/query-string-javascript

params.name: name
params.description:
can be any string, but in this app, it will be a char,
      the name of the query string parameter we want the value of

return.description: the value of name, or null

name: src/MemberButtonBox.js
MemberButtonBox
description: MemberButtonBox holds the Member buttons, which are hoverable.

unknown.tagValue: {string} classname - the className to control style
{function} onEvent - a handle function (handleFieldChange)

name: state
description: stores the value of selected

name: highlight
description:
Highlight sets the string it is passed to state.
When HoverButtons are created the boolean selected
passed as a prop is set to wether the HoverButton
value === this.state.selected

name: render
description: Renders

return.description: a ButtonBox, passes ButtonBox an Array of HoverButtons

name: src/MenuBox.js
MenuBox
description: MenuBox renders most of the menu controls for the app.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} data - the app data object, includes fields, cycle, and unit metadata
{string[]} dates - an array of dates/dirs where images are located
{string} selectedDate - the current date selection for display
{function} handleDateChange - passes new selections up to main
{function} handleCycleChange - passes new selections up to main
{function} handleFieldChange - passes new selections up to main

name: componentDidMount
description:
Create the control structure that inhibits multiple
menus being open at once.

name: createSwitchboard
description:
The switchboard data structure is a map set to state.
Only menu in the map can be open simultaneously.
The fields from this.props.data are mapped to 0s.
(thus menus built from other data are not controlled
by switchboard, i.e. date menu or dir menu)

name: handleDateMenuToggle
description:
Dates menu has its own toggle. It is either open or not,
which is saved to MenuBox state, regardless of the field menus.

name: handleSwitchboardToggle
description: Toggling field menus open or closed.

params.name: field
params.description:
the name of the field, value of the
field menu passed up when it is clicked, corresponds to the
names mapped in switchboard

name: render
description:
Renders menus, controls, and menu-like displays of information about
the current image product selection.

return.description: div > DomainButton, DateMenu, CycleButtonBox, FieldMenus, and MenuLinks

name: src/MenuLink.js
MenuLink
description:
A closed menu box that does not "open". Instead,
clicking MenuLink clicks away.

unknown.tagValue: {string} url - the link
{string} label - the button label

name: render
description: Renders

return.description: a div > h3 > a, FaExternalLink

name: src/MonthHeader.js
MonthHeader
description:
MonthHeader is passed an int and renders a corresponding
Julian calendar Month abbreviation in a div marked up with
a "month" class.

unknown.tagValue: {int} month - an int from 0-11

name: getMonth
description:
Given an int from 0-11, returns a Julian month string,
i.e. 0 => "Jan", 11 => "Dec", etc.

params.name: num
params.description: a number 0-11 that corresponds to a Julian month

return.description: a string, a Julian month abbreviation

name: render
description: Get the month and render that string marked up with div

return.description: div - the month string in a div

name: src/Popup.js
Popup
description:
Popup is a barebones, textbook implementation of
 a React Portal component. Taken from the
 React docs.

name: element
description: The popup will exist in this div, hooked into popupRoot

name: componentDidMount
description: Append element to popupRoot

name: componentWillUnmount
description: Remove element from popupRoot

name: render
description:
Create a portal, render this element
 and its children.

return.description: this.props.children, this.element

name: src/PopupContent.js
PopupContent
description:
PopupContent is a div styled with props, that renders its children.
 Popup renders its children through a React Portal. PopupContent
 has a fixed position directly aligned with the to the top right corner
 of the FieldMenu rectangle it is associatd with.

unknown.tagValue: {string} top - the top position for PopupContent (should be the top of the FieldMenu rectangle)

{string} left - the left position for PopupContent
             (should be the right coordinate + 5px of the FieldMenu rectangle)
{HTML Element} children - JSX for PopupContent to render.

name: render
description: PopupContent renders its child props.

return.description: div > this.props.children

name: src/TrowFragment.js
TrowFragment
description:
TrowFragment is a button displaying its props.date
 marked up with a div of "trow" class.

unknown.tagValue: {string} date - can be any string to display in the div
{function} onEvent - a function, something for the button to do onClick

name: onEvent
description: onClick, the button will pass this.props.date to this.props.onEvent

name: render
description: Render a button inside a div of class "trow"

return.description: div > button

name: src/UnitButton.js
UnitButton
description:
UnitButton is a hover button-live element displaying its label
 marked up with a div of "button" class and "selected" if active.

unknown.tagValue: {string} label - can be any string to display in the div
{string} value - the label, but needed if the value differs from the label
{boolean} selected - true if the container div knows this button is active
{function} highlight - a function, something for the button to do onClick

name: onEvent
description: highlight wrt this.props.value on mouse over

name: render
description:
A div that triggers the highlight function passed to it on mouse over.
Conditionally styled with props.selected

return.description: div > span > label

name: src/UnitButtonBox.js
UnitButtonBox
description:
UnitButtonBox has left/right mouse button controls, as well as
clickable, hoverable, buttons that are highlighted when active.

unknown.tagValue: {string[]} buttonValues - strings to be mapped to UnitButtons
{string} title - the unit title for this set of values
{string} classname - a string to assign the class name for the button box
{function} onEvent - a handleUnitChange function from Main to deal with unit change.

{function} change - flips the selected image index forward or back in DataCanvasContainer
                               (parent) so the selected image updates in the DataCanvas

name: state
description:
store the current unit selection as the value itself of that unit
for conditional style (highlight)

name: componentWillUnmount
description: Remove event key listener

name: selectedIndex
description: generator returns the index of selected

name: highlight
description:
Highlight stores the current selection,
passes that index up to DataCanvasContainer
and sends the selected unit to Main for handling the img src

name: onArrowDown
description:
onArrowDown handles the logic of the arrow key listeners.
selected index increases or decreases with respect to button values
and values are highlighted as arrow keys are pressed.

name: render
description: Renders a button-box of a buttons box filled with unit buttons.

return.description: div > div > h3, div > UnitButtons

name: src/index.js
src/registerServiceWorker.js

content: **Author:** Emily K. Grimes **Date:** October 24, 2018 ## Table of Contents - [How the App Works](#how-the-app-works) - [For Developers](#for-developers) - [Debugging the App](#debugging-the-app) - [Useful Tools](#useful-tools) - [Reproducing the App](#reproducing-the-app) - [Important Little Things](#important-little-things) ## How the App Works NEWS-e Forecast Viewer is a desktop web application that allows for the easy selection of image products to view by selecting important parts of image file names from menus. There are images corresponding to day (Date), time (Forecast, Minute, Hour, Period), Percentile, and product (Environment, Rad/Sat/QPF, Severe, Rotation, Verification, Members). A choice from any of the menus will update the `src` value of the `` element holding the image product in the middle of the view. Menus rely on metadata provided in a `json` file that should be named for the build and placed in `public/data` relative to `src/ `. The Warn-On Forecast group uses NEWS-e Forecast Viewer to conduct user research studies on forecasters. For the Dates menu to be accurate, when the app is in active use, `public/data/getdates.sh` must be run (on the server where the build is live) every day until the user tests are complete. ## For Developers NEWS-e Forecast Viewer has been built out several times for different user groups. Each build has its own branch in git. Typing `git branch` in console while in the directory will reveal branches for builds. `master` refers to "realtime". Differences in builds include changing the survey link and other minor layout differences, but generally revolve around the name of the `json` file referenced in the main app container to `fetch`. the `json` data structure is very specific. The Warn-On Forecast team knows this data structure and is responsible for providing the file to the app for each build. ### Debugging the App This project was bootstrapped with Create React App. Check out the most recent documentation for CRA [here](https://github.com/facebookincubator/create-react-app/blob/master/packages/react-scripts/template/README.md). To truly feel comfortable with the codebase, you will need to be familiar with CRA, and [React.js](https://reactjs.org/) in particular. The [documentation](https://reactjs.org/docs/getting-started.html) for React is very robust and relatively easy to read and understand if you understand Javascript and web development principles. Starting there if you are new to React will be a big help. Otherwise, reading through this document (where you are now) will help you understand the code as I have written it. To the left the components that make this app work are organized and documented based on the way the src folder is organized with respect to .js files. Every class, function, and state object has been commented. #### Useful Tools If the app has issues, a helpful tool to debugging is the React Developer Tools browser extension for [Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/react-developer-tools/fmkadmapgofadopljbjfkapdkoienihi?hl=en) and [Firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/react-devtools/). React syntax is very well supported in [Atom text editor](https://atom.io/), a free text editor with many useful packages for developers. It is available in the Self Service app store. ### Reproducing the App From the terminal, navigate to the directory where the src folder is. For example: ` cd rwof ` Make any changes that may need to be made in src, and again from terminal: ` npm run build ` This command will produce a production build of the app in vanilla webstack code. The contents of the *build* folder that appears level with *src* can be moved to a live web server. #### Important Little Things A production build will not work properly if the *package.json* file lacks an attribute for the homepage. This information gets translated to complete relative links written in "syntactic sugar" or short hand code. So before running the **build** command, be sure to add the relative live address for where this app will live on the web server to *package.json* on the outermost attribute level on the tree. For example: ` "homepage": "/projects/wof/news-e/realtime" ` is appropriate for a build that has its *index.html* placed at `https://www.nssl.noaa.gov/projects/wof/news-e/realtime`. In this example, ` build ` was renamed to `realtime`.
name: ./README.md
package.json
